meanings.sent1: She was uglifying the room by painting it an unpleasant color.
meanings.sent2: The artist was uglifying the portrait by adding exaggerated features.
meanings.sent3: The prankster thought it would be funny to start uglifying the garden gnomes.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were uglifying the once bright sky.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti was uglifying the clean walls of the building.

meanings.definition: The act of causing something to become less attractive.
meanings.sent1: The uglifying of the landscape was evident after the construction project.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the gradual uglifying of the old building due to neglect.
meanings.sent3: The constant rain was the main cause of the garden's uglifying.
meanings.sent4: The spread of litter was an ongoing process of uglifying the park.
meanings.sent5: The company's decision to cut costs led to the uglifying of their products.
